name: unwarrantably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is unacceptable and wrong, because there is no good or fair reason for it: The commission found that the article was unfair to the complainant and unwarrantably infringed her privacy. All too often this film unwarrantably accentuates the positive.
More examplesFewer examplesSocial workers are often accused of intervening unwarrantably into families and removing their children inappropriately.Her music has been unwarrantably ignored since her death in 1994.She complained that her privacy had been unwarrantably infringed in the programme as broadcast.
